column1: Crime Intelligence and Data Analytics MSc
column3: School of Computing, Engineering & Design Technologies
column5: Understanding data is becoming increasingly important for us all. This is especially true for the intelligence analyst working for a police intelligence unit or business analytics department. The world constantly presents data in data frames or spreadsheets – our daily activities are invariably logged by a time, date, geolocation.The work boundaries of the traditional police intelligence analyst and digital forensic investigator are becoming blurred – today’s analysts need to be cyber aware, understanding how communication records and web search histories can be extracted and analysed.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: September enrolment: 1 year, January enrolment: 16 months, including a summer break
